H0.text: Sun is the source from which most of the energy used by living things comes either directly or indirectly.

H1.text: Water is the source from which most of the energy used by living things comes, either directly or indirectly.

H2.text: Horizon is the source from which most of the energy used by living things comes either directly or indirectly.

H3.text: Earth is the source from which most of the energy used by living things comes, either directly or indirectly.

A4.text: Photosynthesis converts light energy — typically from sunlight — into the chemical energy necessary to fuel their metabolism.

A5.text: The average rate of energy captured by global photosynthesis is approximately 130 terawatts, which is about eight times the total power consumption of human civilization.
